Package de.interactive_instruments.etf.bsxm

Class GraphX

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.basex.query.QueryModule
      • de.interactive_instruments.etf.bsxm.GraphX
  • public final class GraphX
extends org.basex.query.QueryModule
    This module supports the creation of graphs and performing algorithms on them.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GraphX

        public GraphX()

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init​(java.lang.String databaseName)
        Initialize the GrapX module with the database name Must be run before using other functions. Database names must be suffixed with a three digits index, i.e. DB-000. Throws IllegalArgumentException if database name is not suffixed with a three digits index.
        Parameters:
        databaseName - full database name ( i.e. DB-000 )

      • resetSimpleGraph

        public void resetSimpleGraph()
        Resets the simple graph held by this module. Use this method to ensure that resources can be reclaimed once the graph is no longer needed.

      • addVertexToSimpleGraph

        public void addVertexToSimpleGraph​(org.basex.query.value.node.DBNode vertex)
        Adds the given database node as a vertex to the simple graph held by this module. NOTE: Before a new graph is created, ensure that a previously established graph is reset using resetSimpleGraph().
        Parameters:
        vertex - the database node to add to the graph as a new vertex

      • addEdgeToSimpleGraph

        public void addEdgeToSimpleGraph​(org.basex.query.value.node.DBNode vertex1,
                                 org.basex.query.value.node.DBNode vertex2)
        Adds an undirected edge between two vertices of the simple graph held by this module. The two vertices must already be contained in this graph. If they are not found in the graph, an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        vertex1 - represents one end of the edge
        vertex2 - represents the other end of the edge

      • determineConnectedSetsInSimpleGraph

        public org.basex.query.value.node.FElem determineConnectedSetsInSimpleGraph()
        Returns:
        A DOM element, with the connected sets (represented as a sequence of nodes of the vertices in the set) that were found in the simple graph; the element can be empty (if the simple graph held by this module is empty). The element has the following (exemplary) structure: 
         
 <graph:ConnectedSets xmlns:graph=
    "https://modules.etf-validator.net/graphx/1">
   <graph:set>
     <graph:ConnectedSet>
       <graph:member>
         <!-- A database node that is a vertex in the simple graph and part of the connected set. -->
         <xyz:ElementA ..>
           ..
         </xyz:ElementA>
       </graph:member>
       <graph:member>
         <!-- A database node that is a vertex in the simple graph and part of the connected set. -->
         <xyz:ElementB ..>
           ..
         </xyz:ElementB>
       </graph:member>
       ..
     </graph:ConnectedSet>
   </graph:set>
   ..
 </graph:ConnectedSets>
